004package kut;
005
006import java.io.File;
007import java.io.IOException;
008
009/**
010 * Path management.<p>
011 * Paths must be writen in Linux-Unix format (in Windows inclusive).
012 */
013public class Path {
014  /**
015   * Returns the last component of path 'path'.<p>
016   * If the path is empty, 'base' returns "".<br>
017   * If the path consists entirely of slashes, 'base' returns "".
018   * @param path Path
019   * @return String
020   */
021  public static String base (String path) {
022    String r = new File(path.replace('/', File.separatorChar)).getName();
023    return r == null ? "" : r;
024  }
025
026  /**
027   * Returns the canonical representation of a existent path.<p>
028   * 'path' must exist.<br>
029   * The path returned is cleaned.
030   * @param path Path.
031   * @return 'path' canonicalized.
032   */
033  public static Opt<String> canonical (String path) {
034    File f = new File(path.replace('/', File.separatorChar));
035    if (!f.exists()) return Opt.none();
036    try {
037      return Opt.some(f.getCanonicalPath().replace(File.separatorChar, '/'));
038    } catch (IOException e) {
039      return Opt.none();
040    }
041  }
042
043  /**
044   * Returns a new path joining 'paths'.<p>
045   * NOTE: Be careful with constructions like <pre>
046   *    Path.cat("", "") -> "/"
047   *    Path.cat("", "a") -> "/a"
048   * </pre>
049   * @param paths Paths to join.
050   * @return New path.
051   */
052  public static String cat (String... paths) {
053    return Arr.join(Arr.mk(paths), "/");
054  }
055
056  /**
057   * Returns a new path removing redundants elements of 'path'.
058   * @param path Path to clean.
059   * @return New path.
060   */
061  public static String clean (String path) {
062    File f = new File(path.replace('/', File.separatorChar));
063    return f.toPath().normalize().toString().replace('/', File.separatorChar);
064  }
065
066  /**
067   * Returns the extesion, including '.', of the last component of 'path'.
068   * Examples:<pre>
069   *   extension("a/c") -> ""
070   *   extension("a/c.d") -> ".d"
071   *   extension("a/c.) -> "."
072   * </pre>
073   * @param path Path
074   * @return String
075   */
076  public static String extension (String path) {
077    String r = new File(path.replace('/', File.separatorChar)).getName();
078    int ix = r.lastIndexOf('.');
079    return ix == -1 ? "" : r.substring(ix);
080  }
081
082  /**
083   * Returns the parent directory of 'path'.<p>
084   * 'path' is cleaned.<p>
085   * If 'path' == "" or 'path' == "/" an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.<br>
086   * If 'path' has not slash, it returns "".
087   * @param path Path
088   * @return Path parent.
089   * @throws IllegalArgumentException If 'path' is "" or "/".
090   */
091  public static String parent (String path) {
092    path = clean(path);
093    if (path.equals("") || path.equals("/"))
094      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Path '" + path + "' has not parent");
095    int ix = path.lastIndexOf('/');
096    return ix == -1 ? "" : path.substring(0, ix);
097  }
098
099}
